Still, even a shitty year can have nice moments and wonderful surprises.Read more...
author: Zack Zwiezen, Kenneth Shepard, and John Walker

title: In 2024, We Went All-In On Card Games
description: Most mornings, I stumble out of bed, grab my phone, and crack open some Pokemon packs. Over the last month, I've been consumed by the routine of booting up Pokemon TCG Pocket, a mobile adaptation of the popular card game, and--much like the video games and show encourage--catching 'em all. I've blown through dozens of booster packs by now chasing the thrill of filling my digital library with rare holographic and full-art cards. I know for a fact I'm not alone in this craze, either. Group chats of mine are filled with friends sharing the rewards of their booster packs, and my social media feeds often consist of a handful of screenshots of someone's haul. That's not all that I've seen.Everywhere I looked this year, some kind of card game was killing it and dominating conversations and minds. Balatro grabbed a hold of gamers early into the year and never particularly let go. My favorite part of Final Fantasy VII Rebirth wasn't taking Tifa on a date or watching Nomura and company continue to reinterpret FF7's mythos; it was taking a break from the bloated open world and throwing down the gauntlet in games of Queen's Blood, a territory-based card game within the expansive RPG, and I wasn't the only one who fell in love with it. Everyone I know now plays Magic: The Gathering, and after numerous alluring crossovers and bids from friends, I do too. And by the very end of the year, Pokemon TCG Pocket became a part of all of our day-to-day lives, allowing us to chase the thrilling feeling of filling a digital library with some of our favorite creatures.The point is: In 2024, we proverbially bet big on card games. We went all in, so to speak, and it's fascinating to wonder why this trend has picked up so much steam in recent years. These games vary in complexity and mechanics, but are there some underlying qualities that unify all these examples and make sense of the incredible year that they've enjoyed?Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: You've Got 24 Hours To Grab This Nautical Horror-Adventure For Free On The Epic Games Store
description: Since it's the festive season, Epic is once again giving away a free game every day. The Epic Games Store continues to give away a free game each week, and this week is another nice find with a price that can't be beaten. Every Thursday at 8 AM PT / 11 AM ET, Epic offers at least one free PC game (and sometimes even as many as two or three). All you need to do to claim the free games is create a free Epic account and enable two-factor authentication. You have a week to add the freebies to your library before the new one(s) take their place. At this point, Epic has given away hundreds of free games, and there's no sign that the program will stop any time soon. We keep this article up to date weekly to highlight both the current free games and next week's offerings.Current free game at EpicDredgeToday you can grab Dredge, a single-player fishing adventure with Lovecraftian themes. You've got a little fishing trawler boat and an ocean full of hidden treasures to find, but you've also got to watch out for sinister entities lurking in the dark in this critically acclaimed game.December 19: Vampire SurvivorsDecember 20: Astrea Six-Sided OraclesDecember 21: TerraTechDecember 22: Wizard of LegendDecember 23: Dark and Darker: Legendary Status upgradeDecember 24: Dredge See all free games at Epic Next free game at EpicThe next free game is a mystery, as Epic is keeping it under festive wrapping paper for now. Epic will be doing daily giveaways like it has in past, as December typically sees the company offer free games over two weeks. Last year there were some fun surprises, like DNF Duel, The Outer Worlds: Spacer's Edition, and Art of Rally.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: The second RPS Christmas Cracker 2024
description: The fell moons rise, and in their cold glare emerges a parcel from the dirt. Bloat and gangrene, crimped as if by tourniquet. A dark promise wriggles within. Grip the fibrous handles, feel its jagged soul imprint upon your palm. Now pull! Rend the sinew, tear muscle from bone, hatch their fetid gift! The yoke draws near! Take up the slip and read the words upon its face. Time to enjoy your lovely joke! Q: How can you tell a soulslike fan has fallen in love with a giant ape? Read more
author: RPS

title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 843
description: How‚Äôs your Christmas shopping coming along? I hope you aren‚Äôt having to brave the crowds in these last couple days. Have I ever told you that one of my least favorite things on Earth ‚Äî ON EARTH ‚Äî is parking lots at Christmas? Not. A. Fan. Man, the Costco parking lot by my house? Or, rather, any Costco parking lot in any town in America at Christmas? How can it take 20 minutes for my car to move 20 feet? Ladybugs on the ground are passing my car. A snail that hitched a ride on my car overnight literally climbed back down to the road because it knew it could go faster. üòÇ But I digress‚Ä¶ Tabs loved Christmases, but it was easy for him because he was the boss, whereas I‚Äôm the one who had to do all the jobs. I had to decorate the office, make all the ornaments, get all the gifts, schedule all the cat spa services. It was a lot! Thankfully, Rosie is more chill about Christmas. She pretty much[Continue reading...] The post Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 843 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 861
description: So‚Ä¶what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn‚Äôt, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It‚Äôs just a list of more or less random questions I‚Äôve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Who would you rather go dancing with: your significant other, your best friend or your kid (if you have one)? Honestly, I‚Äôd love to go with Connor, LOL! 2. Spa weekend or a music festival weekend? Spa weekend, 100%. 3. Have you had any eggnog this holiday season? Nope, none! I don‚Äôt really crave it, but if it‚Äôs there, I‚Äôll have a small cup. 4. Who would you rather have lunch with: your favorite musician, your favorite actor, your favorite author or your favorite teacher? Honestly, if she was still alive, lunch with my favorite teacher from elementary would be lovely. The last time I saw her, I was 18. 5. Do you pop the zit or leave it alone? I dunno, how ripe is it? If[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 861 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
